Package game

Class HorizontalPlatformMovement

java.lang.Object
game.HorizontalPlatformMovement
All Implemented Interfaces:
city.cs.engine.StepListener, EventListener
public class HorizontalPlatformMovement extends Object implements city.cs.engine.StepListener
Handles horizontal movement of a platform within specified boundaries.

This class implements StepListener to move a platform back and forth between two horizontal boundaries. The movement is controlled by adjusting the platform's position on each simulation step based on a specified speed. When the platform reaches one of the boundaries, its direction of movement is reversed.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • HorizontalPlatformMovement

      public HorizontalPlatformMovement(city.cs.engine.StaticBody platform, float speed, float rightBoundary, float leftBoundary)
      Constructs a new HorizontalPlatformMovement with specified parameters.

      Initializes the movement control for a platform with defined speed and boundaries. The boundaries are adjusted based on the initial position of the platform to maintain consistent limits relative to its starting point.

      Parameters:
      platform - The platform whose movement is to be controlled.
      speed - The speed at which the platform moves. Positive values move the platform to the right; negative values move it to the left.
      rightBoundary - The rightmost boundary the platform should move to before reversing direction.
      leftBoundary - The leftmost boundary the platform should move to before reversing direction.

  • Method Details

    • preStep

      public void preStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
      Performs no action before the physics step.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • postStep

      public void postStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
      Updates the platform's position after each physics step.

      This method calculates the new position of the platform based on its current speed. If the platform reaches either boundary, the direction of the speed is reversed to change the movement direction, and the position is recalculated accordingly.

      Specified by:
      postStep in interface city.cs.engine.StepListener
      Parameters:
      e - The event details of the post-step phase.
